importantArticles.headline: Many artificial intelligence (AI) stocks have sold off recently, presenting compelling buying opportunities for patient investors.  Here's why Vertiv Holdings (NYSE: VRT) and Nebius Group (NASDAQ: NBIS) stand out as two exciting AI stocks -- and why Nvidia is also an incredible buying opportunity hiding in plain sight.  Daniel Foelber (Nvidia): Despite blowout earnings and impressive new product innovations, Nvidia stock is down over 12% year to date at the time of this writing.
importantArticles.title: Hold Nvidia? Here Are 2 Unstoppable AI Stocks You Can Also Buy.

importantArticles.headline: Data center equipment maker Vertiv (NYSE: VRT), healthcare technology specialist GE HealthCare Technologies (NASDAQ:GEHC), and electrical protection and connection products company nVent Electric (NYSE: NVT) are all Nvidia collaborators, and they all focus on the AI growth opportunity.  The latest announcement of an Nvidia/GE Healthcare collaboration to "advance innovation in autonomous imaging"  highlights the investment case for GE HealthCare: specifically, the company's opportunity to maximize the value of its equipment by incorporating AI into it.
importantArticles.title: Down 13% to 41%, These 3 Nvidia Partners Are Raging Buys

importantArticles.headline: VRT's strong portfolio and rich partner base, along with growing demand for AI infrastructure, are driving growth despite tariff concerns and stretched valuation.
importantArticles.title: Vertiv Shares Attracting Huge Volume: Should You Join the Rush?

importantArticles.title: Why Vertiv Holdings Co. (VRT) Crashed On Wednesday?

importantArticles.headline: Shares in data center equipment maker Vertiv Holdings (NYSE: VRT) tumbled more than 11% by 3 p.m. today.  In addition, some analysts have a more negative outlook on Vertiv.  An analyst at Barclays reduced the company's price target on Vertiv to $100 from $111 and maintained an "equal weight" recommendation, citing potential pressure on revenue and margin.
importantArticles.title: Why Shares in Vertiv Crashed Today

importantArticles.headline: U.S. equities were mostly lower at midday as tech stocks dragged down the Nasdaq and S&P 500.
